subtitle: For thousands of years, ancient cultures around the world
have been using the practice of sound healing,
a healing practice which uses specific audio tones
and vibrational frequencies to repair damaged tissue and cells within the body.
It works on the basis that all matter is vibrating at specific frequencies,
and sickness, disease, depression, and stress
cause human beings to vibrate at a lower frequency.
Playing tones and specific frequencies
that promote healing, happiness, and vitality
can even allow DNA strands to repair themselves,
and several scientific studies have been conducted
on the potential healing benefits of audio sound frequencies.
Sound has been used as a healing tool for centuries,
and is still regularly utilized by many different alternative healthcare centers.
Tibetan singing bowls, tuning forks, drumming therapy, and even chanting
are all used in sound therapy
and many participants experience strong emotions during therapy sessions.
Advocates of sound healing claim that it has the power to heal mental illness,
arthritis, autoimmune disorders, and can even shrink cancerous tumors.
But the most amazing thing associated with frequency, vibration, and energy
is that we can use them to reprogram our DNA
and unlock the unlimited potential of our bodies
alongside the hidden abilities of our minds.
The phrase "junk DNA" has haunted human genetics for years.
Scientists are trying to tell us that 97% of our DNA
is nothing more than a useless piece of junk,
simply because they don't know what its properties are.
This 97% of our DNA may hold the greatest secrets of humanity as a species,
and may unlock unimaginable powers.
This has been proven by researchers from
the Gene and Stem Cell Therapy Program at Sydney's Centenary Institute
who discovered that there is much more to the inactive part of our DNA
than we can even imagine.
This leads me to the amazing quote by Jennifer Kruse, which states:
"Science has already proven some of the wisdom
which the explorers of consciousness have shared throughout time.
95% of DNA appears inactive, science has named it 'Junk DNA.'
We look forward to the scientific discoveries which will force them
to change the name of 'Junk DNA' to 'Jump Drive DNA.'
There is unlimited information within you...
accessible via Consciousness."
There are several modalities still yet to be approved by science
which might, in one way or the other,
help us to reprogram or retrain our DNA,
and that might even help us deal with cancerous cells
or cells mutilated by an array of toxins from the environment.
It can also help us fight emotional challenges
which are known to have adverse effects on health.
With the way our human DNA communicates
and transfers a vast amount of information
via various streams of network,
it has led to the comparison of the human DNA
to a powerful supercomputer.
There are many atoms in one molecule of DNA
as there are stars in the galaxy.
One gram of DNA can potentially hold up to 455 exabytes of information.
And for reference, one exabyte is equal to one billion gigabytes.
This enormous information stored in the human DNA
may hold a key to our spontaneous healing, cell regeneration,
enhanced intuition, and even psychic phenomena
that science is still trying to understand.
Gaining this important insight will, one way or the other,
affect mainstream science as we have come to know it,
and perhaps even the entire nature of our civilization.
There are several scientists and spiritual teachers who are of the opinion
that our DNA can be altered by light and sound frequencies
in a way that has a direct influence on our biology.
The DNA in a way is a kind of language, although a complex one.
Biological approach, along with computer simulations,
have been met with a challenge when trying to understand
this sophisticated language.
DNA is drawn together in specific sequences and formations of information,
but it is the junk DNA that ultimately decides if, for instance,
you can see clairvoyantly,
or whether your cells can cause you to get cancer.
Another interesting discovery regarding our DNA
comes from biologists Dr. David Deamer and Susan Alexjander.
With a master's degree in music,
they discovered that DNA does in fact create its own unique music.
How they came to this knowledge was by measuring
the actual molecular vibrations of DNA,
and then used an infrared spectrophotometer
to carry out the recording of these vibrations in the form of music.
Each section of the DNA was exposed to infrared light,
and the wavelength it absorbed was measured
to determine the sound frequency.
What came out was hauntingly beautiful music,
and as Alexjander said,
"Some of the combinations frequencies, were simply just stunning,
and it felt like it was alive to me."
While the concept of restructuring DNA
and singing DNA with intentional frequency
is both exciting and inspiring to our expansive imagination,
the idea is undoubtedly challenging to practically apply.
However, science does offer a sort of confirmation
that light and sound can actually, in a way,
directly influence the healing process of the body.
This was what a team of researchers at the University of Cincinnati
came to the knowledge of in their research.
They observed a measurable success
when they applied high-frequency electrical signals to vascular cells,
and this produced a significant effect in healing severe and reoccurring wounds
such as diabetic ulcers.
For several years, it has been aired out by many
that the man who created a frequency-healing machine
had the potential to eradicate and provide a cure for various diseases,
fungal bacterial, parasites, and viral infections.
His machine was even believed to be able to cure cancer.
Royal Rife gives a valid suggestion that each and every living organism
has its own specific resonant frequency,
and exposing the body to electrical currents
which target certain pathogens, certain ailments and diseases,
can neutralize, destroy, and eradicate them
without any need of invasive and pharmaceutical procedures.
The ancient Chinese system of medicine known as acupuncture
works in a very similar way.
It connects with the body's energy conduits and systems directly,
and it has provided potent healing opportunities to several million people,
both in the past and present,
and recently, it has even been validated by scientific research.
A series of experiments conducted by neuroelectric therapy engineer
Dr. Margaret Patterson and Dr. Ifor Capel
revealed how alpha brainwaves boosted the production of serotonin in the brain.
Dr. Capel explained:
"As far as we can tell,
each brain center generates impulses at a specific frequency
based on the predominant neurotransmitter it secretes.
In other words,
the brains internal communication system — its language, if you like —
is based on frequency...
Presumably, when we send in waves of electrical energy at, say, 10 Hz,
certain cells in the lower brain stem
will respond because they normally fire within that frequency range."
Additional research upholds the beliefs of mind-body medicine in this sense,
stating that brain waves being in the Alpha state of 8 to 14 Hz,
permit a vibration allowing for more serotonin to be created.
This may explain why most music worldwide has been tuned to 440 Hz,
since the International Standards Organization promoted it in 1953.
When looking at the vibratory nature of the universe,
it's possible that this specific pitch
isn't harmonious with the natural resonance of nature
and may generate negative effects on human behavior and consciousness.
It's said that 440 Hz frequency music actually conflicts
with some of our chakras
that reside from the base of the spine to the heart.
It is said that this frequency stimulates the ego and left brain function,
which can suppress our intuition.
There are tons of conspiracies surrounding this frequency,
and many seem plausible,
given the fact that the mainstream music industry
has incorporated propaganda and mind control for decades.
Many people believe that the change of frequency
was specifically created by the government
as another way to suppress our intuition and psychic powers,
just like the incorporation of fluoride in our drinking water.
In fact, the 440 Hz tuning
and the adding of fluoride in the drinking water
were both introduced by Joseph Goebbels, the Nazi Minister of Propaganda,
and both methods were successful in keeping the masses under control.
Since ancient times, there was a specific frequency
which had presumed healing and soothing properties.
The 432 Hz is said to be mathematically consistent
with the patterns of the universe.
It is said that 432 Hz vibrates with the universe's golden mean
and unifies the properties of light, time, space, matter, gravity, and magnetism
with biology, the DNA code, and consciousness.
When our atoms and DNA start to resonate in harmony
with the spiraling pattern of nature,
our sense of connection to nature is said to be magnified.
The number 432 is also reflected in ratios of the Sun, Earth, and moon,
as well as the procession of the equinoxes,
the Great Pyramid of Egypt, Stonehenge, and the Sri Yantra
among many other sacred sites.
Tuning instruments to 432 Hz is an ancient practice,
and many musicians who still do so state that they choose this frequency
because it's more beautiful and harmonious for the ears.
Many people choose to conduct work or meditate to this music
because it can have a calming or comforting effect.
All of these examples point to one specific direction,
and that is the ancient spiritual idea
that the human body is packed with a subtle energetic system
that can be altered in a way by intention, light, and sound frequencies.
For an understanding of these practical terms,
it is vital to have the sensitivity first to detect this energy,
and then, direct it to where it is needed.
But for many people,
the entire process acquiring the sensitivity is too tasking,
and with several methods to be incorporated into part of a daily routine.
Several individuals simply lack the patience to actualize this,
and not to forget our fast paced environment
usually doesn't give the opportunity to achieve this awareness.
Still thriving on making fundamental advances in grasping and understanding
the quantum universe as a whole,
the ancient healing ability of shamanism has been gaining momentum of late,
and its role in healing and development is now a part of everyday discussion.
It is even touted that shamanism may after all
hold the key to healing through sound and energy,
as it provides the best example
of how the combination of directed energy and sound
can lead to healing in the mind and body.
Shamanism employs a rather interesting method in its healing process.
In a shamanic healer's tool kit, the most used and essential healing agent
is the icaros, a sacred song sung by the doctor to the patient.
This is done to affect the well-being and health of the patient
by enchanting the unseen spiritual forces
and influences that have a hold on the individual's body and mind.
In addition to the use of icaros,
shamans also employ other tuning or musical instruments,
along with bundled dried leaves, to create sounds
that have an influential hold on the body's energetic system.
Usually combined with different plant medicines,
shamanic practices have a potent, positive influence on the sick.
And in recent times, scientists are now recognizing
the potential benefits of the alkaloid-rich medicine in ayahuasca
in the fight against cancer.
A recent publication by Eduardo Schoenberg
of the Federal University of São Paulo
that the harmine and DMT compounds found in ayahuasca
have been observed to inhibit the proliferation of human carcinoma cells
and expedite the death of some cancer cells.
For more information on DMT, watch the video in the top right corner.
In as much as reductionist science
offers a good way of isolating molecular reactions,
any research that revolves around the subject of ayahuasca
is a long way from completion without indicating the potent benefits
of shamanic healers.
The truth still remains that
shamanic healers are always the ones with the ability to bring out
the highest energetic potential
of the chemical compounds present within ayahuasca
or any other medicinal plant.
The administration of the compounds without the consent and authorization
of genuine shamanism is shallow
and apparently lacks the full concept of the healing potential
of shamanic medicines.
They use of icaros,
which is the essential healing agent in shamanism,
and other instruments of vibration and sound,
can show us that the ancients had a vast understanding
of a critical part of science which relies on vibration and frequency
to achieve success.
Even though the idea that frequency and vibration can in a way affect DNA
and the healing process of the body,
it is one that is interesting to come to terms with.
The theory in itself is one that is challenging to both prove and disprove,
and as it has been observed,
the answers in one way or the other may not satisfy everyone.
Truth, as seen over the years,
is all dependent on a person's personal experience in many ways,
and when an individual has had a certain level of spiritual experiences
that do not fall under the areas of explainable science,
unfortunately, they are left in a difficult situation
by a world that is bent on disproving mysticism.
Indeed, this still raises complications and heated debate

that tries to keep mysticism and spirituality in the dark,

But as it stands now, and in the coming years,
the human race is meeting challenges

This means that
